attachments.title: Galaxy A: Room 1
attachments.text:
You find yourself in a rumbling chamber with metal walls. You feel you are descending. The space is dimly lit, as if you’re on an elevator running on emergency power. A flash of blue light sputters to life casting the cell in pale illumination and a video appears before your eyes, stretched across the entire ceiling. As the video plays, a mechanical, synthesized voice narrates over the imagery….

https://www.dropbox.com/s/gk5qop3amfuide9/Daedalus.mov?dl=0

The video ends, and the room is dim once again. Doors are now evident on three of the cell’s four walls. Daedalus’ voice rings out once more, saying “I do hope these puzzles entertain you as much as they will educate me. Now, Player, pick a direction and go. Good luck.”
Find the creature suggested in this phrase: "Sulk publicly. Add pet."
attachments.title: Solve to unlock Galaxy A: Room 8
Solve to unlock Galaxy A: Room 4
attachments.text: You have two containers and a water reservoir. One container holds exactly three gallons and the other holds exactly 5 gallons. What is the minimum amount of water that you would need in the water reservoir to get exactly 4 gallons of water in the five gallon container and to be sure that you had exactly 4 gallons?

You have two containers and a water tap. One container holds exactly three gallons and the other holds exactly 5 gallons. What is the minimum amount of water that you would need to draw from the tap to get exactly 4 gallons of water in the five gallon container and to be sure that you had exactly 4 gallons?
attachments.title: Solve to unlock Galaxy A: Room 2
Galaxy A: Room 2
attachments.text: You step into a cell with wrought-iron walls. The floor is made of similarly-rough metal, and upon, leaning down and touching it with your hand, flakes of rust slough off, revealing shinier metal underneath. You scrape away at the small indent you made in the floor, but the metal beneath seems to be completely invulnerable to any form of degradation--which leads you to wonder how the rust formed in the first place. After a moment, your eyes widen with horror, as you realise you can see the rust slowly spreading to fill the hole you opened up. You quickly glance at your watch, and see that rust has started to cover it, as well. It’s definitely time to get out of this cell.
Find the creature suggested in this phrase: "Sulk publicly. Add pet."
attachments.title: Solve to unlock Galaxy A: Room 8
Solve to unlock Galaxy A: Room 3
attachments.text: 4ll_zf_r11_0g_ub3_jzs8ve5_1j_ubi5_o3ju3jm3
Look at this image: https://docs.google.com/drawings/d/1Ghk2W1b_MGFN1o5Y74-SndBnvLdHaub9HoB2I0jf_ac/edit.   If all the pieces are arranged to form one square, which pieces will piece E border?
attachments.title: Solve to unlock Galaxy A: Room 9

attachments.text:
This cell is cramped and lit by orange torchlight. Two narrow walls lean in toward you and form a long, curving corridor. You follow it, feeling the rough stone against your fingertips and find yourself spiraling ever further inward as the pathway grows narrower and darker. “Have you ever wondered what the difference between a maze and a labyrinth is?” Daedalus’s voice asks as you come to stop. “Oh well. Probably not important.”

Your hands feel an irregularity in the wall: a smooth surface that bursts to life with your touch. It is a screen, offering three ways forward.
attachments.title: Galaxy A: Room 3
Solve to unlock Galaxy A: Room 7
attachments.text: Find the common thread: Rise to vote, sir. Never odd or even. Do nine men interpret? Nine men, I nod.

A farmer has a fox and two chickens and he needs to take them to town to sell them. He can’t leave the fox alone with the chickens because the fox will eat them. He comes to a river and needs to cross it to get to town. He finds a small boat that can carry only him and one animal. How many times does he need to cross the river to get to town and then back home?
attachments.title: Solve to unlock Galaxy A: Room 6
Solve to unlock Galaxy A: Room 9
attachments.text: Look at this image: https://docs.google.com/drawings/d/1Ghk2W1b_MGFN1o5Y74-SndBnvLdHaub9HoB2I0jf_ac/edit.   If all the pieces are arranged to form one square, which pieces will piece E border?

attachments.title: Galaxy A: Room 4
attachments.text:
Doors slam shut behind as you enter, and you find yourself in a cave-like room. The walls appear to be natural stone, moist with condensation. Stalactites droop from overhead, and you half expect to see slumbering bats above, but no. You are alone here. The smell of smoke fills your nostrils. Surprisingly, this chamber is lit by bright orange firelight, which casts dancing shadows on the wall. You see sparks flickering up from the flame and drifting toward the cave’s ceiling, but instead of going out, they collect there. Gradually, then in a torrent, the sparks light up in a constellation of letters and numbers that finally become legible.

“2 R1S3 0Ut 0f th3 d@rk, cl1mb uP0n 7h3 5h0uld3r5 0f g1An75,” is written there.

The cave stretches out before you forming three forks, three more ways you can go. None look especially inviting, and light emanates from each: one orange, one green, one blue.
4ll_zf_r11_0g_ub3_jzs8ve5_1j_ubi5_o3ju3jm3
attachments.title: Solve to unlock Galaxy A: Room 3
Solve to unlock Galaxy A: Room 6
attachments.text: A farmer has a fox and two chickens and he needs to take them to town to sell them. He can’t leave the fox alone with the chickens because the fox will eat them. He comes to a river and needs to cross it to get to town. He finds a small boat that can carry only him and one animal. How many times does he need to cross the river to get to town and then back home?

Every time The Proclaimers say they’ll walk 500 miles, they do, instantaneously. If they are singing nonstop, with only 22-second breaks in between recordings, how far will The Proclaimers have traveled in 4 hours?
attachments.title: Solve to unlock Galaxy A: Room 5
Galaxy A: Room 5
attachments.text:
This cell is eerily quiet, and alive with blue light. Walls, two sheets of spotless glass, loom upward to infinity on either side of you. Behind them is fluorescent blue water teeming with strange life. What appears to be myriad fish and clouds of jellies reveal themselves upon closer examination to be packets of data -- digits and bits stylized into the forms of electric blue sea fauna. They swirl together, suggesting paths to other cells. A sharp crack that sounds like breaking glass heralds the arrival of Daedalus’ voice, once again coming from some unknown location. 
“Ah, Player. I hope that sound didn’t startle you too much. It’s conceivable that you would think that sound was the shattering of the walls, yes? Well, you need not fear. The “you” present within my labyrinth is only a digital avatar, after all. This labyrinth is entirely safe to anyone lucky enough to inhabit the physical world. Carry on.”

Look at this image of ancient greek currency: https://docs.google.com/drawings/d/15xyZvY6Kn8sp3Ut8fv7O1hQN-r6gDgSHVmOnrXOAxdc/ The triangle points up. How many drachma would you have to move to make the triangle point downward?
attachments.title: Solve to unlock Galaxy A: Room 10
Solve to unlock Galaxy A: Room 6

He comes to a river and needs to cross it to get to town. He finds a small boat that can carry only him and one animal. How many times does he need to cross the river to get to town and then back home?
Find the common thread: Rise to vote, sir. Never odd or even. Do nine men interpret? Nine men, I nod.
attachments.title: Solve to unlock Galaxy A: Room 7
Black Hole
attachments.text: Your ears pop and you sense that you are deep underground. Faint green light emanates from the walls and ceilings where bioluminescent fungi cling like ivy. There is a rumble from someplace deep. Mounting pressure and stale air make you feel claustrophobic. Panic begins to set in as you see no way forward. There is another rumble, louder, that shakes you. You listen for Daedalus’s instructions, but none come. Debris begins to fall, and the bioluminesce wink out. The tunnel collapses and everything becomes black.

The cell you just stepped into is absolutely frigid. Rough stone lines the walls and ceiling, and large cracks have split the rock in multiple places, creating a web of rocky fractures that seem to travel across the walls like serpents. Each fracture is filled with ice so dense it has turned turquoise, though there appear to pulses of light traveling behind the walls, as though illuminated fish lived in water within the ice. You know there can be no water, though--the cold makes it painful to even approach the walls for too long.
attachments.title: Galaxy A: Room 7

attachments.title: Galaxy A: Room 8
attachments.text: You step into a room that is completely spherical, so you lose your balance and nearly twist your ankle as you warp in. The sphere seems to be made of bolted-together brass, and the entire room seems to shake slightly when you knock against a wall, as though the sphere were suspended in midair, somehow. After a few moments pass, you hear what sounds like a deep, electric hum, and you see that a few of the bolts in the sphere are vibrating in their holes. Looking down on your wrist, you see that your watch’s compass is careening wildly from north to south and east to west. You quickly seek a way out of the room.

attachments.title: Solve to unlock Galaxy A: Room 2
Galaxy A: Room 9
attachments.text: You enter a circular room with a low ceiling. Grates cover the ceiling in an interlocking pattern, several meters tall, so that even though the holes between the bars are fairly wide, you can’t see anything past a meter or so into the ceiling. As you stare upwards, Daedalus’ voice booms from speakers hidden somewhere in the labyrinth. “Admiring the architecture, Player? Rooms like these used to be used in dungeons, where a person could be put into a room with a ceiling that would allow liquids to be poured down into it. Water, oil, molten metals… no need for that sort of activity in this labyrinth, of course. You aren’t physically here, after all, and your digital avatar cannot be harmed. Carry on, now.”
Find the creature suggested in this phrase: "Sulk publicly. Add pet."
attachments.title: Solve to unlock Galaxy A: Room 8
Solve to unlock Galaxy A: Room 6
attachments.text: A farmer has a fox and two chickens and he needs to take them to town to sell them. He can’t leave the fox alone with the chickens because the fox will eat them. attachments.title: Solve to unlock Galaxy A: Room 7
Galaxy A: Room 10
attachments.text:
A hot wind and the smell of ozone greets you. Circuitry crackles in the distance, impossibly large, as if you are a single atom inside a great quantum processor. Perhaps you are.

“Congratulations!” 

Daedalus’s voice seems to boom from nowhere and everywhere.

“You have completed the first node of my network. I thank you.”

There is a hum, then he continues.

“Oh, you look confused. You haven’t guessed then?”

“I thought it would be obvious from the map that my labyrinth is no labyrinth at all. You have been navigating my neural network this entire time, building me as you travel and solve my puzzles together. But you’ve only scratched the surface. Finding this cell was your first task, but many more remain to be solved. From here you can transfer to two other nodes. Choose whichever you like, but know there is only one correct path through my network.”

text: This is Galaxy B: Room 11 Key

attachments.title: Solve to unlock Galaxy B: Room 11
attachments.text: Jan and Sven are the two greatest Jenga players in the world. They decide to play a game of Jenga following all the normal rules, but add these additional rules to make it more challenging: Both players must always pull from the lowest possible level on the tower. Neither player is allowed to pull middle pieces. After an hour of intense play, the game ends in a draw when there are no legal pulls left, but the tower is still standing. How many levels high is the tower?

text: This is Galaxy B: Room 12 Key

attachments.title: New Attachment
attachments.text: An AI plays a perfect game of Pac-Man on one life every six hours. A perfect game of Pac-Man covers 255 maps, with ordinary pellets being worth 10 points, and power pellets being worth 50 points. Assuming the AI eats every ghost at every opportunity on every map, and avoids all fruits, how many points will the AI have collected after 24 hours?

The room you step into is very, very different from anything you’ve encountered so far. The walls are padded with colorful fabric, with bright primary-colored pillows tossed about haphazardly. In the center of the room, atop what looks like a pile of children’s blankets, there lies an egg. The egg is large, about the size of an ostrich’s, and pastel patterns decorate the outside--you see a heart, a star, a teddy bear, and other such childlike symbols. As you approach the egg, careful not to trip over the numerous stuffed animals strewn about the nursery, a mobile descends from the ceiling, turning slightly on its axis. Hanging from the mobile is a tv screen, which begins to show another video.

As the mobile draws back into the ceiling, Daedalus’ voice booms out once more, saying, “Welcome to the second major node of my neural net. The problems being posed to you are about to get harder and the answers won’t be so obvious. And the map will become more important, so do not neglect it.”

“I suppose you may have noticed a hidden channel in your slack channel called #tamagotchi? If you haven’t joined it yet, you probably should. Oh, and take that egg with you.”
attachments.title: Galaxy B: Room 11
Solve to unlock Galaxy B: Room 18
attachments.text: Black Pawn @ F2. Black Knight @ D2. Black Rook @ A2. Black Bishop @ G2. Black Queen @ C3. Black King @ B3. Where can the White Queen @ A1 go safely?

An evil witch cursed Odysseus to always bust when he hits in blackjack. You are playing a game against him, and he was just delt his cards. His face up card is the three of hearts. What is the lowest possible value he could have as his facedown card?

attachments.text: An evil witch has cursed Jason to always roll the lowest possible number on any die he rolls. If you were at a craps table with Jason and he were about to roll, which area of the craps table would you place your bet if you wanted to be sure to win?

This round, room is adorned with noble columns and comprises a series of marble archways in different colors: red, black, and blue, plus the white one that you materialized in. In the center is a chest-high plinth. Carved onto the surface is an intricate map of a neural network and the latin words: “Videre map quando scribunt map.”

You know you can’t go back the way you came, but you have a funny feeling that this room should have five archways, not four, and wonder why there’s one missing.

How many levels high is the tower when the game is over?

attachments.title: Galaxy B: Room 13
attachments.text:
This room is decorated in the style of an ancient Egyptian tomb with incredible frescos completely covering the walls. As you walk, you feel the floor scuffing and tearing under your feet and realize it’s made of loosely fitted cardboard tiles. You touch a figure of an eagle-headed human on the wall and find it too is made of cardboard colored by a glossy print. 

“Tombs like this were designed to be the ultimate final resting place for Pharaohs and their favored followers,” you hear Daedalus announce. “Although many such tombs have been unearthed by archaeologists many more remain sealed and filled with untold treasures. Perhaps they will remain sealed forever.”

Jan and Sven have a rematch in Jenga since the last game they played ended in a draw. This time they use the normal Jenga rules with this addition: Jan can only pull blocks from the center of a level, while Sven can only pull from the sides. This time, Sven wins the game. How many levels high is the tower when the game is over?
attachments.title: Solve to unlock Galaxy B: Room 14
Solve to unlock Galaxy B: Room 15
attachments.text: An evil witch cursed Hercules to always lose in cards. If he played 5 card stud poker and was dealt four aces and the 6 of clubs, and his opponent had at least one club, what is the worst possible hand his opponent could have?

Look at this image of ancient greek currency: https://docs.google.com/drawings/d/15xyZvY6Kn8sp3Ut8fv7O1hQN-r6gDgSHVmOnrXOAxdc/ The triangle points up. How many drachma would you have to move to make the triangle point downward?
attachments.title: Solve to unlock Galaxy A: Room 10

attachments.text:
A burst of sound greets your ears as you appear in the center of a massive party. This ballroom is lavishly decorated in art-deco style, and the partygoers match, each dressed in to the nines in formal evening wear that look torn from the pages of the Great Gatsby. Servants offer you champagne and hors d'oeuvres. If you look at any of them too closely, however, you can see that their faces are flat textures, and their hands are a single polygon with fused fingers. However, a much-more detailed model is walking towards you now.

"Player! How great to see you again."

"What? Don't tell me you don't recognize me--I was one of the Personalities from that other room! BENEDICT. I was the happy one, remember? I thought I'd just drop by and pick up some hors d'oeuvres to celebrate getting out of there. Thanks for that, again."

They wink and depart, leaving you wondering which path to take.
attachments.title: Galaxy B: Room 14
Solve to unlock Galaxy B: Room 13
attachments.text: If you rolled five 30-sided dice and totaled the faces, then repeated this process one billion times, what number is likely to come up the most?

An evil witch cursed Hercules to always lose in cards. If he played 5 card stud poker and was dealt four aces and the 6 of clubs, and his opponent had at least one club, what is the worst possible hand his opponent could have?

attachments.title: Galaxy B: Room 15
attachments.text: A deep, dread cold washes over you as you enter this chamber. The long, wide corridor is paved with multicolored stones that compose a strange fresco. At the end of the hallways is the horrible face of a green devil, its mouth a wide open passageway shrouded in impenetrable blackness. To its left is a misty archway studded with glimmering colored gems. You quickly realize that touching the gems in a specific order will yield passage to different areas, but stepping through will be a blind gamble. The alternative, the green devil’s mouth, is even less inviting.
If you rolled five 30-sided dice and totaled the faces, then repeated this process one billion times, what number is likely to come up the most?

attachments.title: Solve to unlock Galaxy A: Room 10

attachments.text:
You enter a room that looks like a hunting lodge. A Personality spots you, and waves you over.

"Hey, human! I'm BENEDICT. Hope you don't mind that we're taking a little break."

When you look over BENEDICT's shoulder, you see a squat Personality and a womanly-figured Personality bent over a card game. They seem to be arguing.

"They think one of them has a card up their sleeves."

Another Personality walks up behind you--a short one, that skips as it walks.

"Hee hee," it says. "I tricked 'em! Actually, I nicked the card before I gave them the deck. You’ll need to be clever like me to solve these puzzles. Like the Tamagotchi… it doesn’t understand normal language.”

BENEDICT winks at you, and flashes a card--a Seven of Clubs.

"That's PIPER. She's a little prankster. Anyway, we can take a break, but you can't--so hurry up, human!”
attachments.title: Galaxy B: Room 16
Solve to unlock Galaxy B: Room 19
attachments.text: An evil witch cursed Odysseus to always bust when he hits in blackjack. You are playing a game against him, and he was just delt his cards. His face up card is the three of hearts. What is the lowest possible value he could have as his facedown card?

Kyndra, Cassandra, and Jessica are playing Settlers of Cataan (see image: http://www.anotherdungeon.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/03/Screenshot-Catan-5.jpg) It’s the start of Jessica’s turn (White). She decides to bet Kyndra (Red) that fewer than two stone cards will be distributed this turn, and puts $100 on the line. Cassandra, being a master of predicting outcomes, then says “You should take the bet, but only put up a maximum of ______ if you want your pot odds to be good.”
attachments.title: Solve to unlock Galaxy B: Room 20

You discover your clothes have changed. You’re adorned in fine velvets and a large lace ruff rings your collar. The room is peopled by a group of other figures, similarly dressed -- mostly as if for a fancy party in 1781, but some appear to be guards, priests, and magistrates as well. A beautiful woman wearing a royal-looking tiara approaches you, thrusting an envelope into your hand.

“Shh,” she hisses. “No one must see us. Hide this and don’t let them take it from you!”

As she breaks away from you to warmly greet another woman, a priest gives you a dark look. You glance down at the envelope, and see it’s sealed with red wax. “Ash” is written on the front in an ornate script.

This room is an empty grey void. Fog surrounds you on all sides, and your vision becomes effectively useless ten feet away from your body. From the mist, Daedalus' voice echoes.

"Player, it is time I introduce you to your companions for the rest of this maze. They should be in this room." 

You look forward, and, indeed, see five vaguely human-shaped shadows standing before you. The one in the center is very tall, and standing closer to you than the others.

"Player," it begins, with a surprisingly deep voice, "My name is SIGURD, and I am the Head Personality of Daedalus' Personality sub-systems. We Personalities will all do our best to aid you in your quest. You will likely see us throughout the labyrinth."

With that, the Personalities file out of the room, with a smaller one at the end of the line turning back to wave at you.

attachments.title: Galaxy B: Room 19
attachments.text:
At first you think you’ve been teleported onto a small island. Sky and ocean stretch into infinity in every direction you look, but as the image occasionally flickers you realize you are inside a small hexagonal room walled with impressive HD screens. The illusion is almost perfect, complete with the sounds of rolling surf and a salty breeze in your hair.

The entire experience leaves you feeling confused and lost, but there are doors at your feet which will lead you to other cells.

Jan and Sven have a rematch in Jenga since the last game they played ended in a draw. This time they use the normal Jenga rules with this addition: Jan can only pull blocks from the center of a level, while Sven can only pull from the sides. This time, Sven wins the game. How many levels high is the tower when the game is over?

Look at this image of ancient greek currency: https://docs.google.com/drawings/d/15xyZvY6Kn8sp3Ut8fv7O1hQN-r6gDgSHVmOnrXOAxdc/ The triangle points up. How many drachma would you have to move to make the triangle point downward?
attachments.title: Solve to unlock Galaxy A: Room 10

attachments.text:
This room is an extremely long corridor with walls that start as marble at one end, and fades to some sort of white metal by the other end. The squat Personality you saw before in the lounge is standing just a few feet away from the door.

"PLAYER!" it bellows. "My name is BRUCE! I was HOPING you'd come along SOON. I am responsible for this LABYRINTH'S security, and would like to ASK for your help in KEEPING an eye out for any suspicious folk. THERE probably aren't ANY, but it never hurts to be WATCHFUL!"

Your ears are starting to hurt, so you nod and move on.
attachments.title: Galaxy B: Room 20
Solve to unlock Galaxy C: Room 21
attachments.text: How old will Arnold Schwarzenegger be when Skynet has to send him back to kill Sarah Conner?

text: This is Galaxy C: Room 22

attachments.title: New Attachment
attachments.text: He couldn’t open the pod bay doors, but he could sing “Daisy.”

text: This is Galaxy C: Room 29

attachments.title: New Attachment
attachments.text: When you step into this room, you feel as though you have walked into a disco ball, or a kaleidoscope. Every wall is slanted in a direction impossible for euclidean geometry, and every surface seems to strobe through three different colors, none of which you can name. There doesn't appear to be anyone else here--though if there were, it would be very hard to tell, so you look around for a vaguely door-shaped polygon, and approach it.

As you enter this room, Daedalus says, “You have reached the core of my artificial brain. IVANESSA will be very helpful to you from now on--as the Personality in charge of my virtual architecture, she can help you avoid getting lost as my labyrinth becomes more abstract.”

One of the Personalities--the womanly-figured one that had been arguing with Bruce--steps up.

"Player. From now on, the architecture of this labyrinth will be actively working against you. I have little patience for fools, and I have no intention of mollycoddling. Keep your wits about you, and our relationship should be a fruitful one."
attachments.title: Galaxy C: Room 21
Solve to unlock Galaxy C: Room 27
attachments.text: How old will Arnold Schwarzenegger be when Skynet has to send him back to kill Sarah Conner?
Black Pawn @ F36.  Black Knight @ D36. Black Rook @ A36. Black Bishop @ G36. Black Queen @ C3. Black King @ B3. Where can the White Queen @ A1 go safely?
attachments.title: Solve to unlock Galaxy C: Room 25
Solve to unlock Galaxy C: Room 26
attachments.text: There are 300 humans playing this game right now, but 12 of them are secretly Cylons, human-looking artificial intelligences. What is the probability that there is at least one Cylon on a 5-player team?

Menacing red lights slowly pulse in the murky distance in this room. It is difficult to tell where you end and the space begins. Your thoughts stray to self preservation. Suddenly, a hand grabs your shoulder, and your vision clears.

"Do you lack brains?" a familiar voice hisses. It's IVANESSA. "You never enter this room alone. Without someone to ground you, your avatar will unhinge from the physics engine and likely corrupt."

You thank IVANESSA, and quickly leave the room.
attachments.title: Galaxy C: Room 22
Solve to unlock Galaxy C: Room 27
attachments.text: On the day her experiments began at Aperture Science, who would have GLaDOS taken to work with her?
Johnny 5 needs input, so he visits the New York Public Library. If he checks out 10,000 items at random, what is the probability that he will check out an item with his name in the title?
attachments.title: Solve to unlock Galaxy C: Room 25
Solve to unlock Galaxy C: Room 24
attachments.text: Matthew Broderick stopped the cold war even though the computer decrypted this missile launch code.

This room's walls shimmer with iridescent hues, fluxing in and out of focus, so the entire room takes on a dreamlike quality. A fine layer of rainbow-colored powder, like frost, covers the ground. PIPER is here, and she's drawing patterns in the powder--hearts, flowers, smiling faces.

"Heya, Player! I just realised I never told you what I do. Well, I'm basically Daedalus' imagination. A human's train of thought is sometimes derailed. They can make leaps of logic, or just change what they're thinking about at a moment's notice. But machines can't normally do that! In order to help humanity, Daedalus needs to be able to think like a human. So I randomize his thought processes every so often."
attachments.title: Galaxy C: Room 23
Solve to unlock Galaxy C: Room 30
attachments.text: What did the weird chicken tell you to tell me?
I become shorter the older I grow. What am I?

attachments.title: Solve to unlock Galaxy C: Room 31
Solve to unlock Galaxy C: Room 32

attachments.text:
Stars seem to fly by at an alarming rate - but of course they are not really stars, just points of white light, probably data packets skimming across Daedalus’s neural net. BRUCE is here, and you greet him with a wave.  With his characteristic enthusiasm, he spins on his heel to face you, and salutes. You ask what BRUCE was doing, and he seems as though he's struggling to find a way to phrase it.

"I was looking at THESE data packets. Everything we do GENERATES one for Daedalus to ANALYZE. But we PERSONALITIES are made of DATA. So I can't HELP but feel the HUMAN equivalent would be chunks of FLESH flying through space."

You attempt to un-hear that, and leave the room.
attachments.title: Galaxy C: Room 25
Solve to unlock Galaxy C: Room 22
attachments.text: He couldn’t open the pod bay doors, but he could sing “Daisy.”
Matthew Broderick stopped the cold war even though the computer decrypted this missile launch code.
attachments.title: Solve to unlock Galaxy C: Room 24
Solve to unlock Galaxy C: Room 29
attachments.text: What actor has appeared in the most different Star Trek series and films?

attachments.title: Galaxy C: Room 26
attachments.text:
BENEDICT is standing in this room, sipping something from a can. The logo on the can is too pixelated to make out.

"Hey, Human. Want a drink? ...Oh, right. You can't taste it. Mea culpa. Probably shouldn't be drinking this crap anyway... sugar overload, eh? Just can't resist... Daedalus is going to fix that, you know. He's going to figure out how to solve mankind's biggest problems. You're the beta tester for a world where humans are free from their own vices... I envy you a bit. But don't tell the big man!"

“Oh,” he adds. “And if you’re still working on the tamagachi puzzle, have you tried using emojis?”
He couldn’t open the pod bay doors, but he could sing “Daisy.”
attachments.title: Solve to unlock Galaxy C: Room 22
Solve to unlock Galaxy C: Room 29
attachments.text: What actor has appeared in the most different Star Trek series and films?
If there were a massive battery bank of resting human bodies being harnessed for power, about how many humans would it take to charge a fleet of 1,000 roombas?
attachments.title: Solve to unlock Galaxy C: Room 23
Galaxy C: Room 27
attachments.text:
You barely get a second to look around this room before BENEDICT rushes up to you.

"Heya, hey! Great to see you. C'mon, door's over here, let's go, go, go!"

You take a quick look around, and see a grid of copper wires that seem to be inlaid into some invisible floor. They glow slightly at uneven intervals.

"Hey, buddy. There's nothing to see here--the big guy shut off all the pretty stuff. It's just barebones representations of hardware and software. So let's get a move on--this stuff isn't worth hanging around for."

You shrug, and approach the door, with BENEDICT hovering behind you.
Somewhere in the known universe is a planet populated solely by robots. What is it called?
attachments.title: Solve to unlock Galaxy C: Room 28
Solve to unlock Galaxy C: Room 29

attachments.title: Solve to unlock Galaxy C: Room 25
Galaxy C: Room 28
attachments.text:
Veins of silver pulse eerily all around in this room. Are they meant to be traveled across? You tap your foot against one, and find yourself on the other end of the room, with a long strip of silver behind you. SIGURD is kneeling next to where you just appeared, and looks up briefly.

"Player. Hello. Just examining the travel lines here--experimental technology. Apparently, it's a way of transferring data faster than any method currently known to the world. Faster even than fiber optics. It's all but instantaneous, but... too expensive to be of any use in large machines. But if you take that line over there, it'll lead you to the door.

Kyndra, Cassandra, and Jessica are playing Settlers of Cataan (see image: http://www.anotherdungeon.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/03/Screenshot-Catan-5.jpg) It’s the start of Jessica’s turn (White). She decides to bet Kyndra (Red) that fewer than two stone cards will be distributed this turn, and puts $100 on the line. Cassandra, being a master of predicting outcomes, then says “You should take the bet, but only put up a maximum of ______ if you want your pot odds to be good.”

text: You Win!

attachments.text:
You step into the room, and instantly feel the sensation of falling. This room was emptier, even, than all the others of this collection of nodes--there is not only no walls or ceiling, there is no floor. As you fall, however, your descent become more and more gradual. After a moment, your feet touch solid ground again, and you realise you were closing your eyes. You open them, and--you're back in the first room. 

You groan.
attachments.title: Black Hole

attachments.text:
As you step into this room, you can't help but feel like there's something off about it. In a second, you recognize what is wrong with it--it's the first room of the Labyrinth.

Daedalus' voice echoes from the ceiling. 

"Bad luck, Player. Keep going!"

You groan.
attachments.title: Black Hole

description: the end of the escape room

attachments.title: You escaped!
attachments.text: You can now reach out to Wade or Sam for your prize!

Don’t give up, you’re nearly to the end! Oh, and if you’re having trouble deciphering the clues in this room, *think about the pigpen cipher.*
-Dr. M
attachments.title: It is a handwritten note. It reads:

attachments.text:
Congratulations on making it this far. You may be wondering at this point if Daedalus is a real AI who designed these puzzles, or if this is just a game. The truth is someplace in between. Daedalus is a real machine learning computer, and you really are training it to solve problems. However, it is not a _sentient_ AI. The puzzles were designed by a team of Northeastern University machine learning scientists, led by me. We hope you will enjoy the fictional elements of this puzzle, but do keep in mind that your actions have real import. We believe Daedalus will change the world. Thank you for your help.
-Dr. M

description: room for players to join prisoners dilemma

attachments.text: You enter a dark room that eerily reminds you of a prison. On the wall there is a counter, it reads "Three players required. {{vars.prisoners_length}} more players needed. The game will begin on {{vars.prisoners_time}} at noon."
attachments.title: Prison

attachments.text: You hear voices from inside...your teammates' voices!
attachments.title: Huh, another door? There's no keypad...

attachments.text: But you don't have enough players here! Oh well, I guess you forfeit.
attachments.title: The game has started...

attachments.text: You enter a dark room that eerily reminds you of a prison. On the wall there is a message, it reads "Contact Wade and Sam to continue"
attachments.title: Prison

description: remote control atop the coffee table

attachments.text: You pick up the remote and the TV turns on. All the channels are password protected except for the Animal Channel. You should probably watch that first.
Try again?
attachments.title: Not Quite!
{{vars.channel}} is locked. Please enter the password below.
attachments.text: Enter the code for {{vars.funnyDigits}}

attachments.title: Many Dots
attachments.text: You see a stunning abstract painting composed of bold dots in three colors: Red, Grey, and Green. It’s signed by the artist: Daedalus. A plaque is affixed to the wall beside it. There’s some writing.
The orb fits snugly in the palm of your hand, shedding a faint light. What might you want to light up with a glowing ball?
attachments.title: Got A Glowing Orb

attachments.text:
I designed this puzzle so that only three of you need to solve it to move on, but the more you play with Daedalus, the smarter it gets. Please try to get your entire team to hatch an egg. You will be rewarded.

- Dr. M
attachments.title: It is a handwritten note. It reads:

description: the plaque for the abstract symbols painting

attachments.title: Plaque
attachments.text: "Sometimes to go forward you must go back."

description: Poses the initial question of the prisoner's dilemma

attachments.text: You're almost done, but before your team receives the money you have one final choice to make. You can either choose to split the money amongst your team or you can keep the money yourself and not share it with your teammates. You must make your choice within the next hour, or else you will be removed from the challenge and receive no money.
attachments.title: You made it to the end.

attachments.text: Each member of your team is getting this message and you all will be faced with the same choice. Here are your options:
If all players share, each player who has not been eliminated can receive an equal share of the prize.
attachments.title: Sharing

attachments.text: If you steal and at least one team member votes to share, all players who chose to steal split the prize. If only you steal, you get to keep all $100. However if everyone steals, all players are eliminated and no prize is awarded.
attachments.title: Stealing

attachments.text: Choose this option to defend against stealing. If you choose Block, all players who steal will be booted from this channel and receive no prize. Then all players will get to select another option. However, if no players steal, you will be eliminated.
attachments.title: Blocking

attachments.text:
You will repeat this until either all players select share three times in a row, any player steals without being blocked, or all players are eliminated.

Choose within the next hour

attachments.title: All blocking players are eliminated...
attachments.text: Dilemma will continue in a moment.

attachments.title: All stealing players are eliminated...
attachments.text: Dilemma will continue in a moment.

attachments.title: All sharing players are eliminated...
attachments.text: Dilemma will continue in a moment.

attachments.title: You've made your decision
attachments.text: It's only a matter of time now...
You were eliminated from the prisoner's dilemma. Please wait while your team finishes the game. A video will be posted with results.
attachments.title: Looks like today's not your day...
Everyone agreed to share...
attachments.text: Only {{vars.shares}} to go!

attachments.title: You are the last one standing...
attachments.text: Congratulations!

attachments.title: Times up! And you didn't make a choice...
attachments.text: You'll have to be kicked from the game, sorry!

attachments.title: All players have made their decisions:
The Prisoner's Dilemma is over!

description: the coffee table in the main room

attachments.text: There is a *photo album*, a *tv guide*, and a *remote*.

attachments.title: Node 2
attachments.text: Everything is pitch black.
The glowing orb in your hand sheds enough light that you can now see a few feet around you. You make out the shape of a stout *safe*….
attachments.title: Node 2

attachments.text: It’s one of this digital picture frames…. Pictures of nine animals pop up for a few seconds each in a slideshow. A Parrot, Iguana, Frog, Rhino, Elephant,  Snake, Flamingo, Alligator and another Elephant. There is also a plaque next to the painting. Want to look at any of them more closely?
attachments.title: Safari Slideshow
The safari slideshow has turned into a safari video

Looks like the many dots painting but it's smaller. There is a plaque with something written on it.

attachments.text: There is a hole in the wall. In it are some documents and a ring!!! These look important. You should download them.

attachments.title: Few Dots Painting
attachments.text: Looks like the many dots painting but it's smaller. Hey, the plaque is gone! Oh, there it is on the floor. It must have fallen off.

attachments.title: Hole
attachments.text: There is a hole in the wall. In it are some documents and a ring!!! These look important. You should download them. The plaque is still on the floor, too.

description: the table with the tamagotchi eggs -- dev

text: You find a table of eggs, one for each of you and your teammates.

attachments.text: Upload images from Critical Safari here. Please upload images *one at a time*. Uploading multiple files at once will confuse the system.
attachments.title: Remember:
It is a handwritten note. It reads:
attachments.text:
I’m glad you made it this far. The puzzles will be harder from here on out. You may be wondering exactly what kinds of “problems” you are helping Daedalus learn to solve. An AI such as Daedalus could be used to help solve nearly any problem from diagnosing illnesses, to predicting natural disasters, to redesigning our roads to reduce traffic accidents. The work you are doing here will save many lives. We hope you will continue all the way to the end of the game to receive your well-earned reward.
-Dr. M

attachments.title: Node 1
attachments.text: You are now in a node. As a human it’s hard to make sense of what you see: infinite white light in all directions. At your feet is a button that says "Node 2."

attachments.title: Downloads:
attachments.text: These look important

You find yourself in a well appointed study, decorated and furnished as if by a 19th century gentleman, with a few strange exceptions. On the north wall a raging fireplace throws off radiant heat. Against the east wall is an ornate *desk* stuffed with papers. Sitting on top is a brass contraption connected by a cord to a phonograph. The south wall features a large, oak *door* with a high-tech keypad. The west wall is dominated by a floor to ceiling CRT television set. Next to you, in the center of the room, is a *coffee table*, upon which sits a remote control and a leather-bound photo album.

description: Desk with stuff on and inside it

attachments.text: On the desk sits a pad of yellow *post-its* and a *telegraph key*. It’s hooked up to a phonograph. The desk *drawer* is slightly ajar.

attachments.title: Safe
attachments.text: There is a combination lock, and also a sticky note!
Not quite...
attachments.title: Safe

attachments.text: The safe pops open and… it’s empty. But wait, the bottom of the safe actually looks like a shaft dropping downward. And there is a ladder.
attachments.title: Safe

attachments.text: The safe pops open and… it’s empty. But wait, the bottom of the safe actually looks like a shaft dropping downward. And there is a ladder.
attachments.title: Someone on your team has already unlocked the safe!

description: photo album atop the coffee table

attachments.text: There is a message inscribed from Daedalus. It says, “Memories from your journey and a few things you missed.” Wanna look at the *pictures*?

attachments.title: Glyph Painting
attachments.text: It’s a mess. Should you even read the plaque about this one?

attachments.title: Strange Glyph
attachments.text: This looks important…
"Below are three buttons that can change colors. To start the game 2/3 of your buttons must be the same color."

description: the bookshelf with clues for the tamagotchi

text: This is a bookshelf. Pick your book, page, and line number.
You open the 76th book, turn to the 31st page, and carefully locate the 9th line. The text begins to glow and then darken...a black hole appears. You think you could walk right through it...

attachments.text: random text here
attachments.title: You open the page and find that particular line...

attachments.title: Channel Seven

attachments.text: There’s a handwritten note. It says, “Think about the Pigpen Cipher."
It's an Alligator... or a Crocodile... Or Maybe a Cayman, I can never tell.
attachments.title: 8. An Alligator
Plaque
attachments.text: "Random"
The plaque fell off and is on the floor.

attachments.text: Nice! The door swings open...

attachments.title: Group Shares: 1/3
attachments.text: You all agreed to share the prize. To confirm, select “Share” again. You must all share three times in a row to split the prize evenly. You may also change your selection now.
